title: Wastewater-based protocols for SARS-CoV-2: insights into virus concentration, extraction, and quantitation methods from two years of public health surveillance
content:
Environ. Sci.: Water Res. Technol., 2024, Advance Article
DOI: 10.1039/D3EW00958K, Paper
Open Access
  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Dagmara S. Antkiewicz, Kayley H. Janssen, Adélaïde Roguet, Hannah E. Pilch, Rebecca B. Fahney, Paige A. Mullen, Griffin N. Knuth, Devin G. Everett, Evelyn M. Doolittle, Kaitlyn King, Carter Wood, Angellica Stanley, Jocelyn D. C. Hemming, Martin M. Shafer
A systematic analysis of widely used concentration, extraction and quantification methods, to identify which ones perform best for wastewater surveillance of SARS-CoV-2, PMMoV and BCoV. Accuracy, sensitivity, and throughput metrics were evaluated.
To cite this article before page numbers are assigned, use the DOI form of citation above.
